intro: Scrophularia × ritae, commonly known as the hybrid foxglove, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Scrophularia × ritae is often found in woodland edges and grassy areas, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
